info.description: Move your app forward with the gpi API
info.title: gpi API

post.description: This API is a status confirmation update to inform the tracker about the updated status of a given payment

parameters.name: LAUApplicationID
parameters.description: ID that identifies the application generationg the API and used by the gpi Connector to retrieve the related LAU keys

parameters.name: LAUVersion
parameters.description: version of the LAUSigned header. Mandatory. "1.0" for this first release

parameters.name: LAUCallTime
parameters.description: timestamp in UTC of the API call in the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ

parameters.name: LAURequestNonce
parameters.description: a random value generated by the client. Provided with the request and copied by the gpi Connector on the response

parameters.name: LAUSigned
parameters.description: service specific HTTP headers

parameters.name: LAUSignature
parameters.description: contains the LAU signature, base64 encoded

parameters.name: SignatureRequired
parameters.description: a field indicating that a Signature is required

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: an api key given to your application

parameters.name: x-record
parameters.description: a type of API response to get from API Sandbox

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Status Confirmation Request

LAUApplicationID.description: ID that identifies the application generationg the API and used by the gpi Connector to retrieve the related LAU keys

LAUVersion.description: version of the LAUSigned header. Mandatory. "1.0" for this first release

LAUCallTime.description: timestamp in UTC of the API call in the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ

LAURequestNonce.description: a random value generated by the client. Provided with the request and copied by the gpi Connector on the response

LAUResponseNonce.description: a random value generated by the gpi Connector on the response

LAUSignature.description: contains the LAU signature, base64 ecoded

from.description:
The sending MessagingEndpoint that has created this Business Message for the receiving MessagingEndpoint that will process this Business Message.

Note	the sending MessagingEndpoint might be different from the sending address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

business_service.description:
Specifies the business service agreed between the two MessagingEndpoints under which rules this Business Message is exchanged.
To be used when there is a choice of processing services or processing service levels.

update_payment_scenario.description: Specifies which payment scenario is to be updated.

uetr.description:
Contains the unique end to end transaction reference. 
Format is lowercase separated by hyphens.

instruction_identification.description:
Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: The instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

payment_status.description: Contains the details on the payment status.

UpdatePaymentStatusRequest.description: This API is a status confirmation update to inform the tracker about the updated status of a given payment.

UpdatePaymentStatusResponse.description: This API is the response to a status confirmation update to inform the tracker about the updated status of a given payment.

my_institution.description: Specifies the institution which payments are requested.

uetr.description: Contains the unique end to end transaction reference (UETR) of a payment.

GetPaymentTransactionDetailsRequest.description:
This API is a payment query to get detailed information regarding a given payment transaction. It requires the UETR to be known.
Examples of use cases are:
	Debtor status check - debtor's agent or debtor wants to see the status
	Creditor status check - creditor's agent or creditor wants to see the status

uetr.description: Contains the unique end to end transaction reference of a payment.

transaction_status.description: Specifies the status of a transaction, in a coded form.

initiation_time.description: Date and Time at which the message enters the tracking system (e.g. gpi).

completion_time.description:
Time at which the Instructed Bank reports that the transaction has been completed. 
Date and time based on the creation date of the status confirmation containing a final status ACSC

last_update_time.description: Last date and time at which the status of this transaction was updated.

payment_event.description: This groups the information of an event, i.e., of a payment message or status confirmation update. It is repeated as many times as there are events to be returned.

GetPaymentTransactionDetailsResponse.description:
This API is the response to a payment query to get detailed information regarding a given payment transaction.
Examples of use cases are:
	Debtor status check - debtor's agent or debtor wants to see the status
	Creditor status check - creditor's agent or creditor wants to see the status

my_institution.description: Specifies an institution that is owned by the sender, for which the sender can ask payment transaction details.

time_window.description: Time window for this institution to which the search applies.

payment_scenario_return_criteria.description: Criteria that specify which payment scenario is to be returned by the search.

agent.description: Identifies agent(s) involved in a payment transaction.

location.description: Specifies the location of the search.

instruction_identification.description:
Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: The instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

transaction_status.description: Specifies the status of a transaction, in a coded form.

amount.description: Specifies the amount range for a given currency and amount type.

event.description: Specifies one of the states of the payment transaction.

subject_to_cancellation_process_indicato.description:
Indicates whether only payment transactions under a past or present stop and recall process should be retrieved. 
Absence means no.

maximum_number.description: Indicates the maximum number of entries returned.

more.description: Contains the token to get the next set of responses.

GetPaymentTransactionsRequest.description:
This API is a payment transaction search to get transaction-level information regarding all payments that match the search criteria. To have full information of a given payment transaction, the GetPaymentTransactionDetailsRequest can be used.
Examples of use cases are:
	Investigation by a participating institution based on criteria given by a customer, such as instructed amount, time of initiation
	Flow monitoring, for instance to find payments that are "stuck" for which the institution is the beneficiary institution
	Feed a dashboard - give all payment transactions with their last status

payment_transaction.description: contains the payment transactions that meet the search criteria.

total_number.description: Contains the total number of returned result entries.

more.description: Contains a token to obtain the next set of responses. It indicates whether there are more results to retrieve, what timestamp to start from and how many more result entries are to be retrieved.

GetPaymentTransactionsResponse.description:
This API is the response to a payment transaction search to get transaction-level information regarding all payments that match the search criteria.
Examples of use cases are:
	Investigation by a participating institution based on criteria given by a customer, such as instructed amount, time of initiation
	Flow monitoring, for instance to find payments that are "stuck" for which the institution is the beneficiary institution
	Feed a dashboard - give all payment transactions with their last status

my_institution.description: Specifies the institution which payments are requested.

start_time.description: Contains the start date and time as from which the last changed payment transactions must be provided.

more.description: Contains a token to obtain the next set of responses. It indicates whether there are more results to retrieve, what timestamp to start from and how many more result entries are to be retrieved.

GetChangedPaymentTransactionsRequest.description:
This API is a delta query to get all payment update information starting from a given date and time. This API allows synchronization of a local database with the tracker database. 
All use cases applicable for the get and search of payment transactions apply also for this API. 
The use of the API to get the last changed payment transactions is driven by an architectural choice to feed a local database and to optimise the flow between the tracker and the API caller.

payment_transaction.description: contains the payment transactions that meet the search criteria.

total_number.description: Contains the total number of returned result entries.

more.description: Contains a token to obtain the next set of responses. It indicates whether there are more results to retrieve, what timestamp to start from and how many more result entries are to be retrieved.

GetChangedPaymentTransactionsResponse.description:
This API is the response to a delta query to get all payment update information starting from a given date and time. This API allows synchronization of a local database with the tracker database. 
All use cases applicable for the get and search of payment transactions apply also for this API. 
The use of the API to get the last changed payment transactions is driven by an architectural choice to feed a local database and to optimise the flow between the tracker and the API caller.

my_institution.description: Specifies the institution which payments are requested.

from_date_time.description: Date and time at which the range starts.

to_date_time.description: Date and time at which the range ends.

maximum_number.description: Indicates the maximum number of entries returned.

more.description: Contains the token to get the next set of responses.

GetInvalidEventsRequest.description:
This API is a payment events query to get invalid events for payment transactions within a given time frame. An event is either a payment or a status confirmation.
The API is typically used for support or audit purposes, where all invalid messages sent or received are retrievable by one API call.

event.description: Each instance contains one payment event that matches the search criteria.

total_number.description: Contains the total number of returned result entries.

more.description: Contains a token to obtain the next set of responses. It indicates whether there are more results to retrieve, what timestamp to start from and how many more result entries are to be retrieved.

GetInvalidEventsResponse.description:
This API is a payment events response to a query to get invalid events for payment transactions within a given time frame. An event is either a payment or a status confirmation.
The API is typically used for support or audit purposes, where all invalid messages sent or received are retrievable by one API call.

from.description:
The sending MessagingEndpoint that has created this Business Message for the receiving MessagingEndpoint that will process this Business Message.

Note	the sending MessagingEndpoint might be different from the sending address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

business_service.description:
Specifies the business service agreed between the two MessagingEndpoints under which rules this Business Message is exchanged.
To be used when there is a choice of processing services or processing service levels.

uetr.description: Contains the unique end to end transaction reference of a payment.

original_instruction_identification.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original instructing party for the original instructed party, to unambiguously identify the original instruction.

underlying_cancellation_details.description: Provides further information with regards to the cancellation of the payments event.

CancelTransactionRequest.description: This API informs the tracker about the cancellation of a given transaction

CancelTransactionResponse.description: This API is the response to the CancelTransactionRequest.

from.description:
The sending MessagingEndpoint that has created this Business Message for the receiving MessagingEndpoint that will process this Business Message.

Note	the sending MessagingEndpoint might be different from the sending address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

business_service.description:
Specifies the business service agreed between the two MessagingEndpoints under which rules this Business Message is exchanged.
 To be used when there is a choice of processing services or processing service levels.
Example: 001

uetr.description: Contains the unique end to end transaction reference of a payment.

underlying_cancellation_details.description: Provides further information with regards to the cancellation of the payments event.

forwarded_to_agent.description:
Specifies the BIC of the entity to which the entity reporting the status has forwarded the payment transaction.
This element can only be used in case the status is ACSP and the reason is G000 or G001.

TransactionCancellationStatusRequest.description: This call informs the tracker about the updated status of a given payment.

TransactionCancellationStatusResponse.description: This API is the response to a status confirmation update to inform the tracker about the updated status of a given payment.

AnyBICIdentifier.description: Code allocated to a financial or non-financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority, as described in ISO 9362 "Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)".

Max35Text.description: Specifies a character string with a maximum length of 35 characters.

PaymentScenario1Code.description: Describes the payment scenario used for a payment transaction.

UUIDv4Identifier.description: Universally Unique IDentifier (UUID) version 4, as described in IETC RFC 4122 "Universally Unique IDentifier (UUID) URN Namespace".

raw_status.description: Contains the status of the payment taken from field 79 of the MT 199.

detailed_status.description: Contains the detailed status of the payment.

PaymentStatusType2Choice.description: Contains the status of the payment, either as a raw status, or as a detailed status.

Max1850Text.description: Specifies a character string with a maximum length of 1850 characters.

funds_available.description: Date and time at which the funds are available,  as reported in the ACSC status update.

transaction_status.description: Specifies the status of the transaction.

forwarded_to_agent.description:
Specifies the BIC of the entity to which the entity reporting the status has forwarded the payment transaction.
This element can only be used in case the status is ACSP and the reason is G000 or G001.

confirmed_amount.description: The amount confirmed by the Originator. Depending on the Transaction Status, this amount can be the credited amount, pending amount, rejected amount or transferred amount.

foreign_exchange_details.description: Specifies the exchange rate details between two currencies.

charge_amount.description: Amount of money asked or paid for the charge.

StatusDetails2.description: Contains details on the status of a payment.

ISODateTime.description:
A particular point in the progression of time defined by a mandatory date and a mandatory time component, expressed in either UTC time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ), local time with UTC offset format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss+/-hh:mm), or local time format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss). These representations are defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.
Note on the time format:
1) beginning / end of calendar day
00:00:00 = the beginning of a calendar day
24:00:00 = the end of a calendar day
2) fractions of second in time format
Decimal fractions of seconds may be included. In this case, the involved parties shall agree on the maximum number of digits that are allowed.

status.description: Reason for the status, as published in an external reason code list.

reason.description: Provides more details on the status in process.

PaymentStatus3.description: Indicates the payment transaction status and optionally the reason for that status.

TransactionIndividualStatus4Code.description: Specifies the status of a single payment transaction.

PaymentReason1Code.description: Provides the reason for a specific Payment Status.

ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyAndAmount.description: A number of monetary units specified in an active or a historic currency where the unit of currency is explicit and compliant with ISO 4217.

ActiveOrHistoricCurrencyCode.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".

source_currency.description: Currency from which an amount is to be converted in a currency conversion.

target_currency.description: Currency into which an amount is to be converted in a currency conversion.

exchange_rate.description:
Factor used to convert an amount from one currency into another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.

Usage: ExchangeRate expresses the ratio between UnitCurrency and QuotedCurrency (ExchangeRate = UnitCurrency/QuotedCurrency).

CurrencyExchange8.description: Set of elements used to provide details of the currency exchange.

BaseOneRate.description: Rate expressed as a decimal, eg, 0.7 is 7/10 and 70%.

Max350Text.description: Specifies a character string with a maximum length of 350 characters.

transaction_cancellation_status.description: Specifies the status of a cancellation request.

PaymentTransactionCancellationStatus1.description: Provides details on the status of the cancellation of a payment transaction.

CancellationIndividualStatus2Code.description: Specifies the status of a cancellation request.

network_reference.description: Reference assigned by the network when sending the payment.

message_name_identification.description: Specifies the original message name identifier to which the message refers.

business_service.description:
Specifies the business service agreed between the two MessagingEndpoints under which rules this Business Message is exchanged.
To be used when there is a choice of processing services or processing service levels.

tracker_event_type.description: Indicates the type of payment event.

valid.description: Indicates if a payment is consistent (YES) or not (NO).

invalidity_reason.description: Contains the additional information in case the event is not a valid component of a payment transaction.

invalidity_description.description: Contains a textual description as to why the event is not a valid component of a payments transaction.

instruction_identification.description:
Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: The instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

related_reference.description: Identification referring to the underlying payment transaction.

original_instruction_identification.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the original instructing party for the original instructed party, to unambiguously identify the original instruction.

transaction_status.description: Specifies the status of a transaction, in a coded form.

underlying_cancellation_details.description: Provides further information with regards to the cancellation of the payments event.

forwarded_to_agent.description:
Specifies the BIC of the entity to which the entity reporting the status has forwarded the payment transaction.
This element can only be used in case the status is ACSP and the reason is G000 or G001.

funds_available.description:
Date and time at which the funds are available,  as reported in the ACSC status update.
Must only be used when TransactionStatus is "ACSC".

from.description:
The sending MessagingEndpoint that has created this Business Message for the receiving MessagingEndpoint that will process this Business Message.

Note	the sending MessagingEndpoint might be different from the sending address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

to.description:
The MessagingEndpoint designated by the sending MessagingEndpoint to be the recipient who will ultimately process this Business Message.

Note the receiving MessagingEndpoint might be different from the receiving address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

serial_parties.description: Specifies the parties involved in a serial payment scenario.

cover_parties.description: Specifies the parties involved in a cover payment scenario.

sender_acknowledgement_receipt.description: Date and time at which the sender was acknowledged receipt of the message.

received_date.description: Date and time at which the message was acknowledged by the receiver.

instructed_amount.description:
Amount of money to be moved between the debtor (ordering customer) and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.
Usage: This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

confirmed_amount.description: The amount confirmed by the Originator. Depending on the Transaction Status, this amount can be the credited amount, pending amount, rejected amount or transferred amount.

interbank_settlement_amount.description: Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent.

interbank_settlement_date.description: Date on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due.

charge_bearer.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction.

charge_amount.description: Amount of money asked or paid for the charge.

foreign_exchange_details.description: Specifies the exchange rate details between two currencies.

update_payment.description:
Implements the correlation between a payment message and a status update on it. 
Contains the network reference of the payment for which the status confirmation was applicable.

duplicate_message_reference.description: Network reference of the Payment that is the original recorded Payment.

copied_business_service.description: Specifies the copied business service of the market infrastructure.

last_update_time.description: Last date and time at which the status of this Payment event was updated.

PaymentEvent7.description: Contains information coming from the related MT 199 or MT 103, or the StatusConfirmationUpdate.

TrackerEventType1Code.description: Indicates the type of payment event.

YesNoIndicator.description: Indicates a "Yes" or "No" type of answer for an element.

ExternalInvalidPaymentsEvent1Code.description: Specifies the reason why a payments event is an invalid component of a payments transaction.

cancellation_request_details.description: Provides information from the cancellation request.

cancellation_response_details.description: Provides information from the cancellation response.

cancellation_request_tracking_status.description: Specifies the status of the cancellation request.

UnderlyingCancellationDetails2.description: Provides details on the status of the cancellation of the underlying payments event.

cancellation_reason_information.description: Contains information on the reason for the cancellation.

CancellationRequestDetails1.description: Contains detailed information from the cancellation request (e.g. an MT 192 or an MT 199).

CancellationReason6Code.description: Provides the possible reasons why a payment is to be cancelled.

PendingPaymentCancellationReason2Code.description: Provides the reason as to why a payment cancellation request is pending.

investigation_execution_status.description: Provides the status on the execution of an investigation.

CancellationResponseDetails1.description: Contains detailed information from the cancellation response (e.g. an MT 196 or an MT 199).

InvestigationExecutionConfirmation5Code.description: Provides the status on an investigation.

PaymentCancellationRejection3Code.description: Returned when a request for cancellation cannot be executed.

PendingPaymentCancellationReason1Code.description: Provides the reason as to why a payment cancellation request is pending.

debtor_agent.description: Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.

instructing_reimbursement_agent.description: Agent through which the instructing agent (identified in the "From" element) will reimburse the instructed agent (identified in the "To" element).

creditor_agent.description: Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.

CustomerCreditTransferTransactionParties.description: Specifies all the parties involved in a serial payment transaction.

debtor.description: Financial institution that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) financial institutional creditor.

debtor_agent.description: Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor.

intermediary_agent1.description: Agent between the debtor's agent and the creditor's agent.

creditor_agent.description: Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.

creditor.description: Financial institution that receives an amount of money from the financial institutional debtor.

CreditTransferTransactionParties1.description: Specifies all the parties involved in a cover payment transaction.

ActiveCurrencyAndAmount.description: A number of monetary units specified in an active currency where the unit of currency is explicit and compliant with ISO 4217.

ActiveCurrencyCode.description: A code allocated to a currency by a Maintenance Agency under an international identification scheme as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".

ISODate.description: A particular point in the progression of time in a calendar year expressed in the YYYY-MM-DD format. This representation is defined in "XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition - W3C Recommendation 28 October 2004" which is aligned with ISO 8601.

ChargeBearerType3Code.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction.

Max50Text.description: Specifies a character string with a maximum length of 50 characters.

from_date_time.description: Date and time at which the range starts.

to_date_time.description: Date and time at which the range ends.

DateTimePeriodDetails.description: Time span defined by a start date and time, and an end date and time.

PaymentScenario2Code.description: Describes the payment scenario used for a payment transaction.

any_bic.description: Code allocated to a financial or non-financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority, as described in ISO 9362 "Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)".

role.description: Specifies the role of the party in the payment chain.

AgentType1.description: Specifies one or more agents involved in a transaction, with their role.

PaymentsPartyType1Code.description: CodeSet identifying parties involved in a payments transaction.

Location1Code.description: Specifies the location of the search

currency.description: Currency code of the ranged amount.

AmountType1.description: Specifies ranged amounts, for a specific currency and type of amount.

CurrencyCode.description: Code allocated to a currency, by a maintenance agency, under an international identification scheme as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 4217 "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds". Valid currency codes are registered with the ISO 4217 Maintenance Agency, and consist of three contiguous letters.

ImpliedCurrencyAndAmount.description:
Number of monetary units specified in a currency where the unit of currency is implied by the context and compliant with ISO 4217. The decimal separator is a dot.
Note: a zero amount is considered a positive amount.

PaymentTransactionState1Code.description: Contains the different states which a payment transaction can be in.

Number.description: Number of objects represented as an integer.

uetr.description: Contains the unique end to end transaction reference of a payment.

payment_scenario_returned.description: Specifies which payment scenario is returned by the search.

my_institution.description: Specifies an institution that is owned by the sender, for which the sender can ask payment transaction details.

role.description: Specifies the role of the party in the payment chain.

event_time.description: Time determined by the Role that the entity defined in MyInstitution is playing in this transaction.

transaction_status.description: Specifies the status of a transaction, in a coded form.

debtor_agent.description:
Financial institution servicing an account for the debtor. 

Debtor Agent in this case only refers to FI to FI Customer Credit Transfers.

debtor.description:
Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor.

Debtor in this case only refers to Financial Institution Credit Transfer with cover.

agent.description: Identifies the agent(s) currently participating in a transaction.

creditor_agent.description: Financial institution servicing an account for the creditor.

creditor.description:
Party to which an amount of money is due.

This role is only to be used in Financial Institution Credit Transfer with cover

initiation_time.description: Date and Time at which the message enters the Gpi system.

completion_time.description:
Time at which the Instructed Bank reports that the transaction has been completed. 
Date and time based on the creation date of the status confirmation containing a final status ACSC.

instructed_amount.description:
Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.
This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

confirmed_amount.description: The actual amount that has been paid to the ultimate beneficiary, after all charges etc... have been deducted.

last_update_time.description: Last date and time at which the status of this transaction was updated.

cover_payment_event.description: Specifies the payment events related to the underlying cover payment.

PaymentTransaction72.description: Contains details on the payment transaction.

PaymentScenario3Code.description: Describes the payment scenario used for a payment transaction.

PaymentsPartyType2Code.description: CodeSet identifying parties involved in a payments transaction.

transaction_cancellation_status.description: Specifies the status of a cancellation request.

cancellation_status_reason_information.description: Provides status reason with regards to the cancellation of the payment.

assignee.description: Party that the case is assigned to. This is also the receiver of the message.

cancellation_event_date_time.description: Date and Time at which the cancellation response message enters the tracking system and thus on which the status is provided.

PaymentTransactionCancellationStatus3.description: Provides details on the status of the cancellation of a payment transaction.

from.description:
The sending MessagingEndpoint that has created this Business Message for the receiving MessagingEndpoint that will process this Business Message.

Note	the sending MessagingEndpoint might be different from the sending address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

to.description:
The MessagingEndpoint designated by the sending MessagingEndpoint to be the recipient who will ultimately process this Business Message.

Note the receiving MessagingEndpoint might be different from the receiving address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

received.description: Indicates whether a payment has been received or not.

PaymentEvent2.description: Contains elements identifying an event belonging to the transaction.

transaction_status.description: Specifies the status of a transaction, in a coded form.

debtor.description: Party that owes an amount of money to the (ultimate) creditor.

agent.description: Identifies the agent(s) currently participating in a transaction.

creditor.description: Party to which an amount of money is due.

initiation_time.description: Date and Time at which the message enters the Gpi system.

completion_time.description:
Time at which the Instructed Bank reports that the transaction has been completed. 
Date and time based on the creation date of the status confirmation containing a final status ACSC.

instructed_amount.description:
Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party.
This amount has to be transported unchanged through the transaction chain.

last_update_time.description: Last date and time at which the status of this transaction was updated.

CoverPaymentEvent1.description: Specifies a payment transaction related to the underlying cover payment.

uetr.description: Contains the unique end to end transaction reference of a payment.

transaction_status.description: Specifies the status of a transaction, in a coded form.

initiation_time.description: Date and Time at which the message enters the tracking system (e.g. gpi).

completion_time.description:
Time at which the Instructed Bank reports that the transaction has been completed. 
Date and time based on the creation date of the status confirmation containing a final status ACSC

last_update_time.description: Last date and time at which the status of this transaction was updated.

payment_event.description: This groups the information of an event, i.e., of a payment message or status confirmation update. It is repeated as many times as there are events to be returned.

PaymentTransaction76.description: Contains details on the payment transaction.

uetr.description: Contains the unique end to end transaction reference of a payment.

business_service.description:
Specifies the business service agreed between the two MessagingEndpoints under which rules this Business Message is exchanged.
To be used when there is a choice of processing services or processing service levels.

participant.description: Indicates whether the requestor institution participates in the payment transaction identified by the unique end to end transaction reference identification  (UETR).

network_reference.description: Reference assigned by the network when sending the payment.

message_name_identification.description: Specifies the original message name identifier to which the message refers.

instruction_identification.description:
Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction.

Usage: The instruction identification is a point to point reference that can be used between the instructing party and the instructed party to refer to the individual instruction. It can be included in several messages related to the instruction.

from.description:
The sending MessagingEndpoint that has created this Business Message for the receiving MessagingEndpoint that will process this Business Message.

Note	the sending MessagingEndpoint might be different from the sending address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

to.description:
The MessagingEndpoint designated by the sending MessagingEndpoint to be the recipient who will ultimately process this Business Message.

Note the receiving MessagingEndpoint might be different from the receiving address potentially contained in the transport header (as defined in the transport layer).

invalidity_reason.description: Specifies the reason why the event is invalid.

PaymentEvent3.description: Contains the details of an invalid payment event.

ExternalInvalidEventReason1Code.description: Codeset containing the reasons why an event (a message)was invalid in the context of the transaction.
